name: unrecoverable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something, such as money or information on a computer, is unrecoverable, you cannot recover it (= get it back): More than £75 million of debt was written off as unrecoverable. This makes the deleted files unrecoverable. Compare
unrecovered
More examplesFewer examplesSome estimates put the total of unrecoverable loans at many times that figure.A hacker may corrupt the data in order to make it unrecoverable or unusable. If the disk has unrecoverable errors and you do not reformat it, be aware that the file system may be corrupted.

Losing and loss
Add to word list
Add to word list
FINANCE used to describe money that someone has lost or lent and will never get back: unrecoverable costs/debts/loans The credit union had unrecoverable loans totalling 235 billion yen.
IT used to describe information on a computer that has been lost and cannot be found: The data recovery company could restore the client's unrecoverable data from the hard drive.
IT used to describe a mistake in a computer program that cannot be corrected: The critical systems folder was deleted, which might have resulted in an unrecoverable system crash.
